\\"operator_id\\"))\\n    @Column(name = \\"permission\\")\\n    @Builder.Default\\n    private Set<String> permissions = new HashSet<>();\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Authenticates the operator by checking the provided password.\\n     * Uses BCrypt for secure password hashing and comparison.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to check\\n     * @return true if authentication succeeds, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean authenticate(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        return passwordEncoder.matches(password, this.passwordHash);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Sets the password with secure hashing.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to hash and set\\n     */\\n    public void setPassword(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Password cannot be null or empty\\");\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        this.passwordHash = passwordEncoder.encode(password);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check (e.g., \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\", \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\")\\n     * @return true if the operator has the permission, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\\n        if (permission == null || permission.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Check specific permissions first\\n        if (permissions.contains(permission)) {\\n            return true;\\n        }\\n        // Check role-based permissions\\n        return hasRolePermission(permission);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks role-based permissions.\\n     * ADMIN role has all permissions.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check\\n     * @return true if the role grants the permission\\n     */\\n    private boolean hasRolePermission(String permission) {\\n        if (\\"ADMIN\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return true; // Admin has all permissions\\n        }\\n        // Define role-based permission mappings\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_MANAGER\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return permission.startsWith(\\"TOURIST_\\");\\n        }\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_OPERATOR\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\".equals(permission) || \\n                   \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\".equals(permission);\\n        }\\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Updates the last login timestamp.\\n     */\\n    public void updateLastLogin() {\\n        this.lastLogin = LocalDateTime.now();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the full name of the operator.\\n     * \\n     * @return Full name as \\"firstName lastName\\" or username if names are not set\\n     */\\n    public String getFullName() {\\n        if (firstName != null && lastName != null) {\\n            return firstName + \\" \\" + lastName;\\n        } else if (firstName != null) {\\n            return firstName;\\n        } else if (lastName != null) {\\n            return lastName;\\n        }\\n        return username;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates the operator entity.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if valid, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean validate() {\\n Entity representing audit logs for tracking modifications to tourist accounts.\n * Maps to the \'audit_logs\' table in the database.\n * Stores detailed information about who changed what, when, and from where.\n */\n@Entity\n@Table(name = "audit_logs")\n@Data\n@Builder\n@NoArgsConstructor\n@AllArgsConstructor\npublic class AuditLog {\n    \n    @Id\n    @GeneratedValue(strategy = performedBy;\n    \n    @Column(name = "performed_at", nullable = false)\n    private LocalDateTime performedAt;\n    \n    @Lob\n    @Column(name = "old_values", columnDefinition = "TEXT")\n    private String oldValues;\n    \n    @Lob\n    @Column(name = "new_values", columnDefinition = "TEXT")\n    private String newValues;\n    \n    @Column(name = "ip_address", length = 45) // IPv6 max length\n    private String ipAddress;\n    \n    @Column(name = "user_agent", length = 500)\n    private String userAgent;\n    \n    @Column(name = "successful")\n    private Boolean successful;\n    \n    @Column(name = "error_message", length = 1000)\n    private String errorMessage;\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates an audit log entry for a tourist modification action.\n     * \n     * @param action The action performed (e.g., "UPDATE_TOURIST", "CREATE_TOURIST")\n     * @param entityType The type of entity (e.g., "Tourist")\n     * @param entityId The ID of the entity being modified\n     * @param performedBy The username or identifier of who performed the action\n     * @param oldValues Map of old values before modification\n     * @param newValues Map of new values after modification\n     * @param ipAddress IP address of the request\n     * @param userAgent User agent string from the request\n     * @return A new AuditLog instance\n     */\n    public static AuditLog logAction(String action, String entityType, Long entityId, \n                                     String performedBy, Map<String, Object> oldValues, \n                                     Map<String, Object> newValues, String ipAddress, \n                                     String userAgent) {\n        ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();\n        String oldValuesJson = "{}";\n        String newValuesJson = "{}";\n        \n        try {\n            if (oldValues != null && !oldValues.isEmpty()) {\n                oldValuesJson = objectMapper.writeValueAsString(oldValues);\n            }\n            if (newValues != null && !newValues.isEmpty()) {\n                newValuesJson = objectMapper.writeValueAsString(newValues);\n            }\n        } catch (JsonProcessingException e) {\n            // Fallback to simple string representation if JSON serialization fails\n            oldValuesJson = oldValues != null ? oldValues.toString() : "{}";\n            newValuesJson = newValues != null ? newValues.toString() : "{}";\n        }\n        \n        return AuditLog.builder()\n                .action(action)\n                .entityType(entityType)\n                .entityId(entityId)\n                .performedBy(performedBy)\n                .performedAt(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .oldValues(oldValuesJson)\n                .newValues(newValuesJson)\n                .ipAddress(ipAddress)\n                .userAgent(userAgent)\n                .successful(true)\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates an audit log for a failed action.\n     * \n     * @param action The action that failed\n     * @param entityType The type of entity\n     * @param entityId The ID of the entity\n string\n     * @return A new AuditLog instance marked as unsuccessful\n     */\n    public static AuditLog logFailure(String action, String entityType, Long entityId, \n                                      String performedBy, String errorMessage, \n                                      String ipAddress, String userAgent) {\n        return AuditLog.builder()\n                .action(action)\n                .entityType(entityType)\n                .entityId(entityId)\n                .performedBy(performedBy)\n                .performedAt(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .ipAddress(ipAddress)\n                .userAgent(userAgent)\n                .successful(false)\n                .errorMessage(errorMessage)\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Generates a human-readable summary of the changes.\n     * \n     * @return Summary string describing what changed\n     */\n    public String getChangeSummary() {\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder();\n        summary.append("Action: ").append(action)\n               .append(" on ").append(entityType);\n                \n        if (entityId != null) {\n            summary.append(" ID: ").append(entityId);\n        }\n        \n        summary.append(" by ").append(performedBy != null ? performedBy : "Unknown")\n               .append(" at ").append(performedAt);\n        \n        if (successful != null && !successful) {\n            summary.append(" (FAILED: ").append(errorMessage).append(")");\n        } else {\n            summary.append(" (SUCCESS)");\n        }\n        \n        return summary.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Parses old values from JSON string to Map.\n     * \n     * @return Map of old values, or empty map if parsing fails\n     */\n    public Map<String, Object> getOldValuesMap() {\n        return parseJsonToMap(oldValues);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Parses new values from JSON string to Map.\n     * \n     * @return Map of new values, or empty map if parsing fails\n     */\n    public Map<String, Object> getNewValuesMap() {\n        return parseJsonToMap(newValues);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Helper method to parse JSON string to Map.\n     * \n     * @param json JSON string to parse\n     * @return Map representation of JSON, or empty map on failure\n     */\n    private Map<String, Object> parseJsonToMap(String json) {\n        if (json == null || json.trim().isEmpty() || "{}".equals(json.trim())) {\n            return new HashMap<>();\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();\n            return objectMapper.readValue(json, Map.class);\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            // Return empty map if parsing fails\n            return new HashMap<>();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if this audit log contains actual changes.\n     * \n     * @return true if oldValues and newValues are different, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasChanges() {\n        if (oldValues == null && newValues == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        if (oldValues == null || newValues == null) {\n            return true; // One is null, other is not\n        }\n        return !oldValues.equals(newValues);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Pre-persist hook to set default values.\n     */\n    @PrePersist\n }\n    }\n}'}}, {'command_name': 'Plan.finish_current_task', 'args': {}}]

\\"agency_operators\\")\\n@Data\\n@Builder\\n@NoArgsConstructor\\n@AllArgsConstructor\\npublic class AgencyOperator {\\n    \\n    @Id\\n    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)\\n checking the provided password.\\n     * Uses BCrypt for secure password hashing and comparison.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to check\\n     * @return true if authentication succeeds, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean authenticate(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        return passwordEncoder.matches(password, this.passwordHash);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Sets the password with secure hashing.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to hash and set\\n     */\\n    public void setPassword(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Password cannot be null or empty\\");\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        this.passwordHash = passwordEncoder.encode(password);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check (e.g., \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\", \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\")\\n     * @return true if the operator has the permission, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\\n           return true;\\n        }\\n        // Check role-based permissions\\n        return hasRolePermission(permission);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks role-based permissions.\\n     * ADMIN role has all permissions.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check\\n     * @return true if the role grants the permission\\n     */\\n    private boolean hasRolePermission(String permission) {\\n        if (\\"ADMIN\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return true; // Admin has all permissions\\n        }\\n        // Define role-based permission mappings\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_MANAGER\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return permission.startsWith(\\"TOURIST_\\");\\n        }\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_OPERATOR\\".equals(role)) {\\n login timestamp.\\n     */\\n    public void updateLastLogin() {\\n        this.lastLogin = LocalDateTime.now();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the full name of the operator.\\n     * \\n That is, the new content will start at the beginning of the specified line, and the existing content of that line will be moved down. This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. Please use append_file instead, For example, if the file has the following content: ``` 001|contain g 002|contain h 003|contain i 004|contain j ``` and you call insert_content_at_line( file_name=\'file.txt\', line_number=2, insert_content=\'new line\' ) the file will be updated to: ``` 001|contain g 002|new line 003|contain h 004|contain i 005|contain j ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, line_number: int, insert_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name: (str): The name of the file to edit. line_number (int): The line number (starting from 1) to insert the content after. The insert content will be add between the line of line_number-1 and line_number insert_content (str): The content to insert betweed the previous_line_content and current_line_content.The insert_content must be a complete block of code at. NOTE: This tool is exclusive. If you use this tool, you cannot use any other commands in the current response. If you need to use it multiple times, wait for the next turn."}, "open_file": {"type": "function", "description": "Opens the file at the given path in the editor. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. org.hibernate.annotations.CreationTimestamp;\\nimport org.hibernate.annotations.UpdateTimestamp;\\n\\nimport java.time.LocalDate;\\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\\n\\n/**\\n * Entity class representing a Tourist account in the system.\\n * Maps to the \'tourists\' table in the database.\\n * Implements optimistic locking through @Version annotation.\\n */\\n@Entity\\n@Table(name = \\"tourists\\")\\n@Data\\n@Builder\\n@NoArgsConstructor\\n@AllArgsConstructor\\npublic class Tourist {\\n    \\n    @Id\\n    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)\\n    private Long id;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"first_name\\", nullable = false, length = 100)\\n    private String firstName;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"last_name\\", nullable = false, length = 100)\\n    private String lastName;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"email\\", nullable = false, unique = true, length = 255)\\n    private String email;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"phone_number\\", length = 20)\\n    private String phoneNumber;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"date_of_birth\\")\\n    private LocalDate dateOfBirth;\\n    \\n    @Embedded\\n    private Address address;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"nationality\\", length = 100)\\n    private String nationality;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"passport_number\\", unique = true, length = 50)\\n    private String passportNumber;\\n    \\n    @CreationTimestamp\\n    @Column(name = \\"created_at\\", updatable = false)\\n    private LocalDateTime createdAt;\\n    \\n    @UpdateTimestamp\\n    @Column(name = \\"updated_at\\")\\n    private LocalDateTime updatedAt;\\n    \\n    @Version\\n    @Column(name = \\"version\\")\\n    private Integer version;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"is_active\\")\\n    private Boolean active;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the full name of the tourist by concatenating first and last name.\\n     * \\n     * @return Full name as \\"firstName lastName\\"\\n     */\\n    public String getFullName() {\\n        return firstName + \\" \\" + lastName;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Updates the tourist entity with data from the update request.\\n     * Only updates fields that are not null in the request.\\n     * \\n     * @param request The update request containing new values\\n     */\\n    public void updateFrom(TouristUpdateRequest request) {\\n        if (request.getFirstName() != null) {\\n            this.firstName = request.getFirstName();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getLastName() != null) {\\n            this.lastName = request.getLastName();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getEmail() != null) {\\n            this.email = request.getEmail();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getPhoneNumber() != null) {\\n            this.phoneNumber = request.getPhoneNumber();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getDateOfBirth() != null) {\\n            this.dateOfBirth = request.getDateOfBirth();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getAddress() != null) {\\n            this.address = request.getAddress();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getNationality() != null) {\\n            this.nationality = request.getNationality();\\n        }\\n        if (request.getPassportNumber() != null) {\\n            this.passportNumber = request.getPassportNumber();\\n        }\\n        this.updatedAt = LocalDateTime.now();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates the tourist entity for business rules.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if the tourist data is valid, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean validate() {\\n        // Basic validation rules\\n        if (firstName == null || firstName.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (lastName == null || lastName.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (email == null || email.trim().isEmpty() || !email.contains(\\"@\\")) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Date of birth should not be in the future\\n        if (dateOfBirth != null && dateOfBirth.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Active status should not be null\\n        if (active == null) {\\n            this.active = true; // Default to active\\n        }\\n        return true;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Pre-update hook to ensure validation before saving.\\n     */\\n    @PreUpdate\\n    public void preUpdate() {\\n        // Ensure data is valid before updating\\n        if (!validate()) {\\n            throw new IllegalStateException(\\"Tourist data is invalid before update\\");\\n        }\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Pre-persist hook to set default values and validate.\\n     */\\n    @PrePersist\\n .firstName(this.firstName)\n                .lastName(this.lastName)\n                .email(this.email)\n                .phoneNumber(this.phoneNumber)\n \\"operator_id\\"))\\n    @Column(name = \\"permission\\")\\n    @Builder.Default\\n    private Set<String> permissions = new HashSet<>();\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Authenticates the operator by checking the provided password.\\n     * Uses BCrypt for secure password hashing and comparison.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to check\\n     * @return true if authentication succeeds, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean authenticate(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        return passwordEncoder.matches(password, this.passwordHash);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Sets the password with secure hashing.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to hash and set\\n     */\\n    public void setPassword(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Password cannot be null or empty\\");\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        this.passwordHash = passwordEncoder.encode(password);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check (e.g., \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\", \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\")\\n     * @return true if the operator has the permission, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\\n        if (permission == null || permission.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Check specific permissions first\\n        if (permissions.contains(permission)) {\\n            return true;\\n        }\\n        // Check role-based permissions\\n        return hasRolePermission(permission);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks role-based permissions.\\n     * ADMIN role has all permissions.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check\\n     * @return true if the role grants the permission\\n     */\\n    private boolean hasRolePermission(String permission) {\\n        if (\\"ADMIN\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return true; // Admin has all permissions\\n        }\\n        // Define role-based permission mappings\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_MANAGER\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return permission.startsWith(\\"TOURIST_\\");\\n        }\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_OPERATOR\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\".equals(permission) || \\n                   \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\".equals(permission);\\n        }\\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Updates the last login timestamp.\\n     */\\n    public void updateLastLogin() {\\n        this.lastLogin = LocalDateTime.now();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the full name of the operator.\\n     * \\n     * @return Full name as \\"firstName lastName\\" or username if names are not set\\n     */\\n    public String getFullName() {\\n        if (firstName != null && lastName != null) {\\n \n    @Size(min = 1, max = 100, message = "First name must be between 1 and 100 characters")\n    private String firstName;\n    \n    @Size(min = 1, max = 100, message = "Last name must be between 1 must not exceed 100 characters")\n    private String nationality;\n    \n    @Size(max = 50, message = "Passport number must not exceed 50 characters")\n    private String passportNumber;\n    \n &&\n               address == null &&\n               nationality == null &&\n               passportNumber == null &&\n               active == null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if this update request contains any changes for the given tourist.\n     * \n     * @param touristDTO The current tourist data to compare against\n     * @return true if there are actual changes, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasChanges(TouristDTO touristDTO) {\n        if (touristDTO == null) {\n            return !isEmpty();\n        }\n        \n        // Compare each field if it\'s specified in the request\n        if (firstName != null && !firstName.equals(touristDTO.getFirstName())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (lastName != null && !lastName.equals(touristDTO.getLastName())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (email != null && !email.equals(touristDTO.getEmail())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (phoneNumber != null && !phoneNumber.equals(touristDTO.getPhoneNumber())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (dateOfBirth != null && !dateOfBirth.equals(touristDTO.getDateOfBirth())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (address != null) {\n            Address currentAddress = touristDTO.getAddress();\n            if (currentAddress == null || !address.equals(currentAddress)) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        if (nationality != null && !nationality.equals(touristDTO.getNationality())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (passportNumber != null && !passportNumber.equals(touristDTO.getPassportNumber())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (active != null && !active.equals(touristDTO.getActive())) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates that at least one field is being updated.\n     * \n     * @return true if at least one field is not null, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasUpdates() {\n        return !isEmpty();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets a summary of what fields are being updated.\n     * \n     * @return String listing updated fields\n     */\n    public String getUpdateSummary() {\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder("Update fields: ");\n        boolean first = true;\n        \n        if (firstName != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("firstName");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (lastName != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("lastName");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (email != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("email");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (phoneNumber != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("phoneNumber");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (dateOfBirth != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("dateOfBirth");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (address != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("address");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (nationality != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("nationality");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (passportNumber != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("passportNumber");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        if (active != null) {\n            if (!first) summary.append(", ");\n            summary.append("active");\n            first = false;\n        }\n        \n        if (first) {\n            summary.append("none");\n        }\n        \n        return summary.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a map of changed values for audit logging.\n     * \n     * @param original The original tourist data\n     * @return Map of field names to new values (only changed fields)\n     */\n    public java.util.Map<String, Object> getChangedValuesMap(TouristDTO original) {\n        java.util.Map<String, Object> changes = new java.util.HashMap<>();\n        \n        if (original == null) {\n            return changes;\n        }\n        \n        if (firstName != null && !firstName.equals(original.getFirstName())) {\n            changes.put("firstName", firstName);\n        }\n        if (lastName != null && !lastName.equals(original.getLastName())) {\n            changes.put("lastName", lastName);\n        }\n        if (email != null && !email.equals(original.getEmail())) {\n            changes.put("email", email);\n        }\n        if (phoneNumber != null && !phoneNumber.equals(original.getPhoneNumber())) {\n            changes.put("phoneNumber", phoneNumber);\n        }\n        if (dateOfBirth != null && !dateOfBirth.equals(original.getDateOfBirth())) {\n            changes.put("dateOfBirth", dateOfBirth);\n        }\n        if (address != null) {\n            Address originalAddress = original.getAddress();\n            if (originalAddress == null || !address.equals(originalAddress)) {\n                changes.put("address", address);\n            }\n        }\n        if (nationality != null && !nationality.equals(original.getNationality())) {\n            changes.put("nationality", nationality);\n        }\n        if (passportNumber != null && !passportNumber.equals(original.getPassportNumber())) {\n            changes.put("passportNumber", passportNumber);\n        }\n        if (active != null && !active.equals(original.getActive())) {\n            changes.put("active", active);\n        }\n        \n        return changes;\n    }\n}'}}, {'command_name': 'Editor.create_file', 'args': {'filename': }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        return passwordEncoder.matches(password, this.passwordHash);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Sets the password       this.passwordHash = passwordEncoder.encode(password);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check (e.g., \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\", \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\")\\n     * @return true if the operator has the permission, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\\n        if (permission == null || permission.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Check specific permissions first\\n        if (permissions.contains(permission)) {\\n            return true;\\n        }\\n        // Check role-based permissions\\n        return hasRolePermission(permission);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks role-based permissions.\\n     * ADMIN role has all permissions.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check\\n     * @return true if the role grants the permission\\n     */\\n    private boolean hasRolePermission(String permission) {\\n        if (\\"ADMIN\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return true; // Admin has all permissions\\n        }\\n        // Define role-based permission mappings\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_MANAGER\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return permission.startsWith(\\"TOURIST_\\");\\n        }\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_OPERATOR\\".equals(role)) {\\n After creating this, I\'ll mark Task 2 as finished and move to Task 3 (creating DTO classes).\n\n```json\n[\n    {\n        "command_name": "Editor.write",\n        "args": {\n            "path": "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/entity/AuditLog.java",\n            "content": "package com.etour.entity;\\n\\nimport jakarta.persistence.*;\\nimport lombok.AllArgsConstructor;\\nimport lombok.Builder;\\nimport lombok.Data;\\nimport lombok.NoArgsConstructor;\\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;\\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;\\n\\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\\nimport java.util.HashMap;\\nimport java.util.Map;\\n\\n/**\\n * Entity representing audit logs for tracking modifications to tourist accounts.\\n * Maps to the \'audit_logs\' table in the database.\\n * Stores detailed information about who changed what, when, and from where.\\n */\\n@Entity\\n@Table(name = \\"audit_logs\\")\\n@Data\\n@Builder\\n@NoArgsConstructor\\n@AllArgsConstructor\\npublic class AuditLog {\\n    \\n    @Id\\n    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)\\n    private Long id;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"action\\", nullable = false, length = 50)\\n    private String action;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"entity_type\\", nullable = false, length = 100)\\n    private String entityType;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"entity_id\\")\\n    private Long entityId;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"performed_by\\", length = 100)\\n    private String performedBy;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"performed_at\\", nullable = false)\\n    private LocalDateTime performedAt;\\n    \\n    @Lob\\n    @Column(name = \\"old_values\\", columnDefinition = \\"TEXT\\")\\n    private String oldValues;\\n    \\n    @Lob\\n    @Column(name = \\"new_values\\", columnDefinition = \\"TEXT\\")\\n    private String newValues;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"ip_address\\", length = 45) // IPv6 max length\\n    private String ipAddress;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"user_agent\\", length = 500)\\n    private String userAgent;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"successful\\")\\n    private Boolean successful;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"error_message\\", length = 1000)\\n    private String errorMessage;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates an audit log entry for a tourist modification action.\\n     * \\n     * @param action The action performed (e.g., \\"UPDATE_TOURIST\\", \\"CREATE_TOURIST\\")\\n     * @param entityType The type of entity (e.g., \\"Tourist\\")\\n     * @param entityId The ID of the entity being modified\\n     * @param performedBy The username or identifier of who performed the action\\n     * @param oldValues Map of old values before modification\\n     * @param newValues Map of new values after modification\\n     * @param ipAddress IP address of the request\\n     * @param userAgent User agent string from the request\\n     * @return A new AuditLog instance\\n     */\\n    public static AuditLog logAction(String action, String entityType, Long entityId, \\n                                     String performedBy, Map<String, Object> oldValues, \\n                                     Map<String, Object> newValues, String ipAddress, \\n                                     String userAgent) {\\n        ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();\\n        String oldValuesJson = \\"{}\\";\\n        String newValuesJson = \\"{}\\";\\n        \\n        try {\\n            if (oldValues != null && !oldValues.isEmpty()) {\\n                oldValuesJson = objectMapper.writeValueAsString(oldValues);\\n            }\\n            if (newValues != null && !newValues.isEmpty()) {\\n                newValuesJson = objectMapper.writeValueAsString(newValues);\\n            }\\n        } catch (JsonProcessingException e) {\\n            // Fallback to simple string representation if JSON serialization fails\\n            oldValuesJson = oldValues != null ? oldValues.toString() : \\"{}\\";\\n            newValuesJson = newValues != null ? newValues.toString() : \\"{}\\";\\n        }\\n        \\n        return AuditLog.builder()\\n                .action(action)\\n                .entityType(entityType)\\n                .entityId(entityId)\\n                .performedBy(performedBy)\\n                .performedAt(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .oldValues(oldValuesJson)\\n                .newValues(newValuesJson)\\n                .ipAddress(ipAddress)\\n                .userAgent(userAgent)\\n                .successful(true)\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates an audit log for a failed action.\\n     * \\n     * @param action The action that failed\\n     * @param entityType The type of entity\\n     * @param entityId The ID of the entity\\n     * @param performedBy Who attempted the action\\n     * @param errorMessage Error message describing the failure\\n     * @param ipAddress IP address of the request\\n     * @param userAgent User agent string\\n     * @return A new AuditLog instance marked as unsuccessful\\n     */\\n    public static AuditLog logFailure(String action, String entityType, Long entityId, \\n                                      String performedBy, String errorMessage, \\n                                      String ipAddress, String userAgent) {\\n        return AuditLog.builder()\\n                .action(action)\\n                .entityType(entityType)\\n                .entityId(entityId)\\n                .performedBy(performedBy)\\n                .performedAt(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .ipAddress(ipAddress)\\n                .userAgent(userAgent)\\n                .successful(false)\\n                .errorMessage(errorMessage)\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Generates a human-readable summary of the changes.\\n     * \\n     * @return Summary string describing what changed\\n     */\\n    public String getChangeSummary() {\\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder();\\n        summary.append(\\"Action: \\").append(action)\\n               .append(\\" on \\").append(entityType);\\n                \\n        if (entityId != null) {\\n            summary.append(\\" ID: \\").append(entityId);\\n        }\\n        \\n        summary.append(\\" by \\").append(performedBy != null ? performedBy : \\"Unknown\\")\\n               .append(\\" at \\").append(performedAt);\\n        \\n        if (successful != null && !successful) {\\n            summary.append(\\" (FAILED: \\").append(errorMessage).append(\\")\\");\\n        } else {\\n            summary.append(\\" (SUCCESS)\\");\\n        }\\n        \\n        return summary.toString();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n          return objectMapper.readValue(json, Map.class);\\n        } catch (Exception e) {\\n            // Return empty map if parsing fails\\n            return new HashMap<>();\\n        }\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if this audit log contains actual changes.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if oldValues and newValues are different, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean [{'command_name': 'Editor.write', 'args': {'path': '/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/dto/TouristResponse.java', 'content': 'package com.etour.dto;\n\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonFormat;\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;\nimport lombok.AllArgsConstructor;\nimport lombok.Builder;\nimport lombok.Data;\nimport lombok.NoArgsConstructor;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\n\n/**\n * Standard API response wrapper for tourist-related operations.\n * Includes status, message, timestamp, and optional data payload.\n * Used for all tourist API responses for consistency.\n */\n@Data\n@Builder\n@NoArgsConstructor\n@AllArgsConstructor\n@JsonInclude(JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL)\npublic class TouristResponse {\n    \n    /** Response status (success, error, warning) */\n    private String status;\n    \n    /** Response message for the user */\n    private String message;\n    \n    /** HTTP status code */\n    private int httpStatus;\n    \n    /** Timestamp of the response */\n    @JsonFormat(pattern = "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss")\n    private LocalDateTime timestamp;\n    \n    /** The actual data payload (e.g., TouristDTO) */\n    private Object data;\n    \n    /** Error details if status is error */\n    private Object errorDetails;\n    \n    /** Request ID for tracing */\n    private String requestId;\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a successful response with data.\n     * \n     * @param message Success message\n     * @param data The data payload\n     * @return TouristResponse with success status\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse success(String message, Object data) {\n        return TouristResponse.builder()\n                .status("success")\n                .message(message)\n                .httpStatus(200)\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .data(data)\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a successful response for tourist update.\n     * \n     * @param touristDTO Updated tourist data\n     * @return TouristResponse with update success message\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse updateSuccess(TouristDTO touristDTO) {\n        return success("Tourist account updated successfully", touristDTO);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a successful response for tourist retrieval.\n     * \n     * @param touristDTO Retrieved tourist data\n     * @return TouristResponse with retrieval success message\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse retrievalSuccess(TouristDTO touristDTO) {\n        return success("Tourist account retrieved successfully", touristDTO);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates an error response.\n     * \n     * @param message Error message\n     * @param httpStatus HTTP status code\n     * @param errorDetails Detailed error information\n     * @return TouristResponse with error status\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse error(String message, int httpStatus, Object errorDetails) {\n        return TouristResponse.builder()\n                .status("error")\n                .message(message)\n                .httpStatus(httpStatus)\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .errorDetails(errorDetails)\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a validation error response.\n     * \n     * @param validationErrors Validation error details\n     * @return TouristResponse with validation error status\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse validationError(Object validationErrors) {\n        return error("Validation failed", 400, validationErrors);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a not found error response.\n     * \n     * @param message Specific not found message\n     * @return TouristResponse with 404 status\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse notFound(String message) {\n        return error(message, 404, null);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a server error response.\n     * \n     * @param message Server error message\n     * @return TouristResponse with 500 status\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse serverError(String message) {\n        return error(message, 500, null);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a confirmation required response.\n     * Used when user confirmation is needed before proceeding.\n     * \n     * @param message Confirmation message\n     * @param confirmationData Data to confirm\n     * @return TouristResponse with confirmation status\n     */\n    public static TouristResponse confirmationRequired(String message, Object confirmationData) {\n        return TouristResponse.builder()\n                .status("confirmation_required")\n                .message(message)\n                .httpStatus(200)\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .data(confirmationData)\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the response indicates success.\n     * \n     * @return true if status is "success", false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isSuccess() {\n        return "success".equals(status);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the response requires confirmation.\n     * \n     * @return true if status is "confirmation_required", false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean requiresConfirmation() {\n        return "confirmation_required".equals(status);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets a summary string for logging.\n     * \n     * @return Summary string\n     */\n    public String getSummary() {\n        return String.format("TouristResponse[status=%s, httpStatus=%d, message=%s]", \n                status, httpStatus, message);\n    }\n}'}}, {'command_name': checking the provided password.\\n     * Uses BCrypt for secure password hashing and comparison.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to check\\n     * @return true if authentication succeeds, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean authenticate(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        return passwordEncoder.matches(password, this.passwordHash);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Sets the password with secure hashing.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to hash and set\\n     */\\n    public void setPassword(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Password cannot be null or empty\\");\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        this.passwordHash = passwordEncoder.encode(password);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check (e.g., \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\", \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\")\\n     * @return true if the operator has the permission, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\\n        if (permission == null || permission.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Check specific permissions first\\n        if (permissions.contains(permission)) {\\n            return true;\\n        }\\n        // Check role-based permissions\\n        return hasRolePermission(permission);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks role-based permissions.\\n     * ADMIN role has all permissions.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check\\n     * @return true if the role grants the permission\\n     */\\n    private boolean hasRolePermission(String permission) {\\n        if (\\"ADMIN\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return true; // Admin has all permissions\\n        }\\n        // Define role-based permission mappings\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_MANAGER\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return permission.startsWith(\\"TOURIST_\\");\\n        }\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_OPERATOR\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\".equals(permission) || \\n                   \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\".equals(permission);\\n        }\\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Updates the last login timestamp.\\n     */\\n    public void updateLastLogin() {\\n        this.lastLogin = LocalDateTime.now();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the full name of the operator.\\n     * \\n After creating this, I\'ll mark Task 2 as finished and move to Task 3 (creating DTO classes).\n\n```json\n[\n    {\n        "command_name": "Editor.write",\n        "args": {\n            "path": "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/entity/AuditLog.java",\n            "content": "package com.etour.entity;\\n\\nimport jakarta.persistence.*;\\nimport lombok.AllArgsConstructor;\\nimport lombok.Builder;\\nimport lombok.Data;\\nimport lombok.NoArgsConstructor;\\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;\\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;\\n\\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\\nimport java.util.HashMap;\\nimport java.util.Map;\\n\\n/**\\n * Entity representing audit logs for tracking modifications to tourist accounts.\\n * Maps to the \'audit_logs\' table in the database.\\n * Stores detailed information about who changed what, when, and from where.\\n */\\n@Entity\\n@Table(name = \\"audit_logs\\")\\n@Data\\n@Builder\\n@NoArgsConstructor\\n@AllArgsConstructor\\npublic class AuditLog {\\n    \\n    @Id\\n    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)\\n    private Long id;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"action\\", nullable = false, length = 50)\\n    private String action;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"entity_type\\", nullable = false, length = 100)\\n    private String entityType;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"entity_id\\")\\n    private Long entityId;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"performed_by\\", length = 100)\\n    private String performedBy;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"performed_at\\", nullable = false)\\n    private LocalDateTime performedAt;\\n    \\n    @Lob\\n    @Column(name = \\"old_values\\", columnDefinition = \\"TEXT\\")\\n    private String oldValues;\\n    \\n    @Lob\\n    @Column(name = \\"new_values\\", columnDefinition = \\"TEXT\\")\\n    private String newValues;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"ip_address\\", length = 45) // IPv6 max length\\n    private String ipAddress;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"user_agent\\", length = 500)\\n    private String userAgent;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"successful\\")\\n    private Boolean successful;\\n    \\n    @Column(name = \\"error_message\\", length = 1000)\\n    private String errorMessage;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates an audit log entry for a tourist modification action.\\n     * \\n     * @param action The action performed (e.g., \\"UPDATE_TOURIST\\", \\"CREATE_TOURIST\\")\\n     * @param entityType The type of entity (e.g., \\"Tourist\\")\\n     * @param entityId The ID of the entity being modified\\n     * @param performedBy The username or identifier of who performed the action\\n     * @param oldValues Map of old values before modification\\n     * @param newValues Map of new values after modification\\n     * @param ipAddress IP address of the request\\n     * @param userAgent User agent string from the request\\n     * @return A new AuditLog instance\\n     */\\n    public static AuditLog logAction(String action, String entityType, Long entityId, \\n                                     String performedBy, Map<String, Object> oldValues, \\n                                     Map<String, Object> newValues, String ipAddress, \\n                                     String userAgent) {\\n        ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();\\n        String oldValuesJson = \\"{}\\";\\n        String newValuesJson = \\"{}\\";\\n        \\n        try {\\n            if (oldValues != null && !oldValues.isEmpty()) {\\n                oldValuesJson = objectMapper.writeValueAsString(oldValues);\\n            }\\n            if (newValues != null && !newValues.isEmpty()) {\\n                newValuesJson = objectMapper.writeValueAsString(newValues);\\n            }\\n        } catch (JsonProcessingException e) {\\n            // Fallback to simple string representation if JSON serialization fails\\n            oldValuesJson = oldValues != null ? oldValues.toString() : \\"{}\\";\\n            newValuesJson = newValues != null ? newValues.toString() : \\"{}\\";\\n        }\\n        \\n        return AuditLog.builder()\\n                .action(action)\\n                .entityType(entityType)\\n                .entityId(entityId)\\n                .performedBy(performedBy)\\n                .performedAt(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .oldValues(oldValuesJson)\\n                .newValues(newValuesJson)\\n                .ipAddress(ipAddress)\\n                .userAgent(userAgent)\\n                .successful(true)\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates an audit log for a failed action.\\n     * \\n     * @param action The action that failed\\n     * @param entityType The type of entity\\n     * @param entityId The ID of the entity\\n     * @param performedBy Who attempted the action\\n     * @param errorMessage Error message describing the failure\\n     * @param ipAddress IP address of the request\\n     * @param userAgent User agent string\\n     * @return A new AuditLog instance marked as unsuccessful\\n     */\\n    public static AuditLog logFailure(String action, String entityType, Long entityId, \\n                                      String performedBy, String errorMessage, \\n                                      String ipAddress, String userAgent) {\\n        return AuditLog.builder()\\n                .action(action)\\n                .entityType(entityType)\\n                .entityId(entityId)\\n                .performedBy(performedBy)\\n                .performedAt(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .ipAddress(ipAddress)\\n                .userAgent(userAgent)\\n                .successful(false)\\n                .errorMessage(errorMessage)\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Generates a human-readable summary of the changes.\\n     * \\n     * @return Summary string describing what changed\\n     */\\n    public String getChangeSummary() {\\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder();\\n        summary.append(\\"Action: \\").append(action)\\n               .append(\\" on \\").append(entityType);\\n                \\n        if (entityId != null) {\\n            summary.append(\\" ID: \\").append(entityId);\\n        }\\n        \\n        summary.append(\\" by \\").append(performedBy != null ? performedBy : \\"Unknown\\")\\n               .append(\\" at \\").append(performedAt);\\n        \\n        if (successful != null && !successful) {\\n            summary.append(\\" (FAILED: \\").append(errorMessage).append(\\")\\");\\n        } else {\\n            summary.append(\\" (SUCCESS)\\");\\n        }\\n        \\n        return summary.toString();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n   public Map<String, Object> getNewValuesMap() {\\n        return parseJsonToMap(newValues);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Helper method to parse JSON string to Map.\\n     * \\n     * @param json JSON string to parse\\n     * @return Map representation of JSON, or empty map on failure\\n     */\\n    private Map<String, Object> parseJsonToMap(String json) {\\n        if (json == null || json.trim().isEmpty() || \\"{}\\".equals(json.trim())) {\\n            return new HashMap<>();\\n        }\\n        \\n        try {\\n            ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();\\n            return objectMapper.readValue(json, Map.class);\\n        } catch (Exception e) {\\n            // Return empty map if parsing fails\\n            return new HashMap<>();\\n        }\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if this audit log contains actual changes.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if oldValues and newValues are different, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasChanges() {\\n        if (oldValues == null && newValues == null) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (oldValues == null || newValues == null) {\\n            return true; // One is null, other is not\\n        }\\n        return !oldValues.equals(newValues);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Pre-persist hook to set default values.\\n     */\\n    @PrePersist\\n    public void prePersist() {\\n        if (performedAt == null) {\\n            performedAt = LocalDateTime.now();\\n        }\\n        if (successful == null) {\\n            successful = true;\\n        }\\n    }\\n}"\n        }\n    },\n    {\n        "command_name": "Plan.finish_current_task",\n        "args": {}\n    }\n]\n```'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Command Editor.write executed: The \\n    /** The actual data payload (e.g., TouristDTO) */\\n    private Object data;\\n    \\n    /** Error details if status is error */\\n    private Object errorDetails;\\n    \\n    /** Request ID  .status(\\"error\\")\\n                .message(message)\\n                .httpStatus(httpStatus)\\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .errorDetails(errorDetails)\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates a validation error response.\\n     * \\n     * @param validationErrors Validation error details\\n     * @return TouristResponse with \\n    /**\\n     * Creates a not found error response.\\n     * \\n     * @param message Specific not found message\\n     * @return TouristResponse with 404 status\\n     */\\n    public static [{'command_name': 'Editor.write', 'args': {'path': '/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/dto/ValidationErrorDTO.java', 'content': 'package com.etour.dto;\n\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonFormat;\nimport com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;\nimport lombok.AllArgsConstructor;\nimport lombok.Builder;\nimport lombok.Data;\nimport lombok.NoArgsConstructor;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\nimport java.util.ArrayList;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Map;\n\n/**\n * Data Transfer Object for validation errors.\n * Used to provide detailed validation error information in API responses.\n * Standardizes error response format across the application.\n */\n@Data\n@Builder\n@NoArgsConstructor\n@AllArgsConstructor\n@JsonInclude(JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL)\npublic class ValidationErrorDTO {\n    \n    /** Timestamp when the error occurred */\n    @JsonFormat(pattern = "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss")\n    private LocalDateTime timestamp;\n    \n    /** HTTP status code */\n    private int status;\n    \n    /** Error type/name */\n    private String error;\n    \n    /** Detailed error message */\n    private String message;\n    \n    /** Request path that caused the error */\n    private String path;\n    \n    /** List of field-specific validation errors */\n    private List<FieldError> fieldErrors;\n    \n    /** Global validation errors (not tied to a specific field) */\n    private List<String> globalErrors;\n    \n    /** Additional error details (context-specific) */\n    private Map<String, Object> details;\n    \n    /**\n     * Inner class representing a field-specific validation error.\n     */\n    @Data\n    @Builder\n    @NoArgsConstructor\n    @AllArgsConstructor\n    public static class FieldError {\n        /** Name of the field with the error */\n        private String field;\n        \n        /** Rejected value (if available) */\n        private Object rejectedValue;\n        \n        /** Error message */\n        private String message;\n        \n        /** Error code/category */\n        private String code;\n        \n        /**\n         * Creates a formatted string representation of the field error.\n         * \n         * @return Formatted error string\n         */\n        public String getFormattedError() {\n            String valueStr = rejectedValue != null ? rejectedValue.toString() : "null";\n            return String.format("Field \'%s\': %s (value: %s, code: %s)", \n                    field, message, valueStr, code);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a ValidationErrorDTO from field errors.\n     * \n     * @param fieldErrors List of field-specific errors\n     * @param path The request path\n     * @return ValidationErrorDTO instance\n     */\n    public static ValidationErrorDTO fromFieldErrors(List<FieldError> fieldErrors, String path) {\n        return ValidationErrorDTO.builder()\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .status(400)\n                .error("Validation Failed")\n                .message("One or more validation errors occurred")\n                .path(path)\n                .fieldErrors(fieldErrors)\n                .globalErrors(new ArrayList<>())\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a ValidationErrorDTO for a single field error.\n     * \n     * @param field The field with error\n     * @param rejectedValue The rejected value\n     * @param message Error message\n     * @param path The request path\n     * @return ValidationErrorDTO instance\n     */\n    public static ValidationErrorDTO createFieldError(String field, Object rejectedValue, \n                                                      String message, String path) {\n        FieldError fieldError = FieldError.builder()\n                .field(field)\n                .rejectedValue(rejectedValue)\n                .message(message)\n                .code("VALIDATION_ERROR")\n                .build();\n        \n        List<FieldError> fieldErrors = new ArrayList<>();\n        fieldErrors.add(fieldError);\n        \n        return fromFieldErrors(fieldErrors, path);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a ValidationErrorDTO for global errors.\n     * \n     * @param globalErrors List of global error messages\n     * @param path The request path\n     * @return ValidationErrorDTO instance\n     */\n    public static ValidationErrorDTO fromGlobalErrors(List<String> globalErrors, String path) {\n        return ValidationErrorDTO.builder()\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\n                .status(400)\n                .error("Validation Failed")\n                .message("One or more validation errors occurred")\n                .path(path)\n                .fieldErrors(new ArrayList<>())\n                .globalErrors(globalErrors)\n                .build();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a field error to this DTO.\n     * \n     * @param fieldError The field error to add\n     */\n    public void addFieldError(FieldError fieldError) {\n        if (fieldErrors == null) {\n            fieldErrors = new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        fieldErrors.add(fieldError);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a simple field error.\n     * \n     * @param field Field name\n     * @param rejectedValue Rejected value\n     * @param message Error message\n     */\n    public void addFieldError(String field, Object rejectedValue, String message) {\n        FieldError fieldError = FieldError.builder()\n                .field(field)\n                .rejectedValue(rejectedValue)\n                .message(message)\n                .code("VALIDATION_ERROR")\n                .build();\n        addFieldError(fieldError);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a global error message.\n     * \n     * @param errorMessage Global error message\n     */\n    public void addGlobalError(String errorMessage) {\n        if (globalErrors == null) {\n            globalErrors = new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        globalErrors.add(errorMessage);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if there are any validation errors.\n     * \n     * @return true if there are errors, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasErrors() {\n        boolean hasFieldErrors = fieldErrors != null && !fieldErrors.isEmpty();\n        boolean hasGlobalErrors = globalErrors != null && !globalErrors.isEmpty();\n        return hasFieldErrors || hasGlobalErrors;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the total number of validation errors.\n     * \n     * @return Total error count\n     */\n    public int getErrorCount() {\n        int fieldErrorCount = fieldErrors != null ? fieldErrors.size() : 0;\n        int globalErrorCount = globalErrors != null ? globalErrors.size() : 0;\n        return fieldErrorCount + globalErrorCount;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a formatted summary of all validation errors.\n     * \n     * @return Summary string\n     */\n    public String getErrorSummary() {\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder();\n        summary.append("Validation failed with ").append(getErrorCount()).append(" error(s):\\n");\n        \n        if (fieldErrors != null && !fieldErrors.isEmpty()) {\n            summary.append("Field errors:\\n");\n            for (int i = 0; i < fieldErrors.size(); i++) {\n                FieldError error = fieldErrors.get(i);\n                summary.append(String.format("  %d. %s\\n", i + 1, error.getFormattedError()));\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (globalErrors != null && !globalErrors.isEmpty()) {\n            summary.append("Global errors:\\n");\n            for (int i = 0; i < globalErrors.size(); i++) {\n                String error = globalErrors.get(i);\n                summary.append(String.format("  %d. %s\\n", i + 1, error));\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return summary.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Converts this DTO to a TouristResponse for API consistency.\n     * \n     * @return TouristResponse with validation error details\n     */\n    public TouristResponse toTouristResponse() {\n        return TouristResponse.validationError(this);\n    }\n}'}}, {'command_name': 'Plan.finish_current_task', 'args': {}}]

\\"country\\", length = 100)\\n    private String country;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the complete formatted address.\\n     * \\n     * @return Full address string in standard format\\n     */\\n    public String getFullAddress() {\\n        StringBuilder addressBuilder = new StringBuilder();\\n        \\n        if (street != null && !street.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            addressBuilder.append(street);\\n        }\\n        \\n        if (city != null && !city.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            if (addressBuilder.length() > 0) {\\n addressBuilder.append(\\", \\");\\n            }\\n            addressBuilder.append(country);\\n        }\\n        \\n        return addressBuilder.toString();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * postalCode.trim().isEmpty()) &&\\n               (country == null || country.trim().isEmpty());\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates the address for basic correctness.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if address is valid, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean isValid() {\\n        // At minimum, city and country should be provided\\n        if (city == null || city.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (country == null || country.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        return true;\\n Operator who can manage tourist accounts.\\n * Maps to the \'agency_operators\' table in the database.\\n * Includes authentication and authorization functionality.\\n */\\n@Entity\\n@Table(name = \\"agency_operators\\")\\n@Data\\n@Builder\\n@NoArgsConstructor\\n@AllArgsConstructor\\npublic class AgencyOperator {\\n    \\n    @Id\\n    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)\\n LocalDateTime lastLogin;\\n    \\n    @CreationTimestamp\\n    @Column(name = \\"created_at\\", updatable = false)\\n    private LocalDateTime createdAt;\\n    \\n    @UpdateTimestamp\\n    @Column(name = \\"updated_at\\")\\n    private LocalDateTime updatedAt;\\n    \\n    @ElementCollection\\n    @CollectionTable(name = \\"operator_permissions\\", joinColumns = @JoinColumn(name = \\"operator_id\\"))\\n    @Column(name = \\"permission\\")\\n    @Builder.Default\\n    private Set<String> permissions = new HashSet<>();\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Authenticates the operator by checking the provided password.\\n     * Uses BCrypt for secure password hashing and comparison.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to check\\n     * @return true if authentication succeeds, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean authenticate(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        return passwordEncoder.matches(password, this.passwordHash);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Sets the password with secure hashing.\\n     * \\n     * @param password The plain text password to hash and set\\n     */\\n    public void setPassword(String password) {\\n        if (password == null || password.isEmpty()) {\\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException(\\"Password cannot be null or empty\\");\\n        }\\n        PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder = new BCryptPasswordEncoder();\\n        this.passwordHash = passwordEncoder.encode(password);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if the operator has a specific permission.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check (e.g., \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\", \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\")\\n     * @return true if the operator has the permission, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasPermission(String permission) {\\n        if (permission == null || permission.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        // Check specific permissions first\\n        if (permissions.contains(permission)) {\\n            return true;\\n        }\\n        // Check role-based permissions\\n        return hasRolePermission(permission);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks role-based permissions.\\n     * ADMIN role has all permissions.\\n     * \\n     * @param permission The permission to check\\n     * @return true if the role grants the permission\\n     */\\n    private boolean hasRolePermission(String permission) {\\n        if (\\"ADMIN\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return true; // Admin has all permissions\\n        }\\n        // Define role-based permission mappings\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_MANAGER\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return permission.startsWith(\\"TOURIST_\\");\\n        }\\n        if (\\"AGENCY_OPERATOR\\".equals(role)) {\\n            return \\"TOURIST_MODIFY\\".equals(permission) || \\n                   \\"TOURIST_VIEW\\".equals(permission);\\n        }\\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Updates the last login timestamp.\\n     */\\n    public void updateLastLogin() {\\n        this.lastLogin = LocalDateTime.now();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Returns the full name of the operator.\\n     * \\n     * @return Full name as \\"firstName lastName\\" or username if names are not set\\n     */\\n    public String getFullName() {\\n        if (firstName != null && lastName != null) {\\n            return firstName + \\" \\" + lastName;\\n        } else if (firstName != null) {\\n            return firstName;\\n        } else if (lastName != null) {\\n            return lastName;\\n        }\\n        return username;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates the operator entity.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if valid, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean validate() {\\n        if (username == null || username.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (passwordHash == null || passwordHash.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (email == null || email.trim().isEmpty() || !email.contains(\\"@\\")) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (role == null || role.trim().isEmpty()) {\\n            return false;\\n        }\\n        if (active == null) {\\n            this.active = true; // Default to active\\n        }\\n        return true;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Pre-persist hook for validation and default values.\\n     */\\n    @PrePersist\\n    public void prePersist() {\\n        if (active == null) {\\n            active = true;\\n        }\\n        validate();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Pre-update hook for validation.\\n     */\\n    @PreUpdate\\n    public void preUpdate() {\\n        validate();\\n    }\\n}"\n        }\n    },\n    {\n            return true;\\n        }\\n        \\n        return false;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Validates that at least one field is being updated.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if at least    * \\n     * @return String listing updated fields\\n     */\\n    public String getUpdateSummary() {\\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder(\\"Update fields: \\");\\n        boolean }\\n        if (lastName != null) {\\n            if (!first) summary.append(\\", \\");\\n            summary.append(\\"lastName\\");\\n            first = false;\\n        }\\n        if (email != summary.append(\\", \\");\\n            summary.append(\\"dateOfBirth\\");\\n            first = false;\\n        }\\n        if (address != null) {\\n            if (!first) summary.append(\\", \\");\\n            summary.append(\\"address\\");\\n            first = false;\\n        }\\n        if (nationality != null) {\\n            if (!first) summary.append(\\", \\");\\n            summary.append(\\"nationality\\");\\n            first = false;\\n        }\\n        if (passportNumber != null) {\\n            if (!first) summary.append(\\", \\");\\n            summary.append(\\"passportNumber\\");\\n            first = false;\\n        }\\n        if (active != null) {\\n            if (!first) summary.append(\\", \\");\\n Example 1: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to replace line 2 and line 3 edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"new content\\", ) This will replace the second line 2 and line 3 with \\"new content\\". The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002|new content 003|contain i ``` Example 2: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to remove the line 2 and line 3. edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"\\", ) This will remove line 2 and line 3. The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002| 003|contain i ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, first_replaced_line_number: int, first_replaced_line_content: str, last_replaced_line_number: int, last_replaced_line_content: str, new_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name (str): The name of the file to edit. first_replaced_line_number (int): The line number to start the edit at, starting from 1. first_replaced_line_content (str): The content of the start replace line, according to the first_replaced_line_number. last_replaced_line_number (int): The line number to end the edit at (inclusive), starting from 1. last_replaced_line_content (str): The content of the end replace line, according to the last_replaced_line_number. new_content (str): The text to replace the current selection with, must conform to PEP8 standards. The content in the start line and end line will also be replaced."}, "find_file": {"type": "function", "description": "Finds all files with the given name in the specified directory. That is, the new content will start at the beginning of the specified line, and the existing content of that line will be moved down. This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. Please use append_file instead, For example, if the file has the following content: ``` 001|contain g 002|contain h 003|contain i 004|contain j ``` and you call insert_content_at_line( file_name=\'file.txt\', line_number=2, insert_content=\'new line\' ) the file will be updated to: ``` 001|contain g 002|new line 003|contain h 004|contain i 005|contain j ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, line_number: int, insert_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name: (str): The name of the file to edit. line_number (int): The line number (starting from 1) to insert the content after.
