an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if this audit log contains actual changes.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if oldValues and newValues are different, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean          .address(tourist.getAddress())\\n                .nationality(tourist.getNationality())\\n                .passportNumber(tourist.getPassportNumber())\\n   "path": "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/dto/ValidationErrorDTO.java",\n            "content": "package com.etour.dto;\\n\\nimport lombok.NoArgsConstructor;\\n\\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\\nimport java.util.ArrayList;\\nimport java.util.List;\\nimport java.util.Map;\\n\\n/**\\n * Data Transfer Object for validation errors.\\n * Used to provide detailed validation error information in API responses.\\n * Standardizes error response format across the application.\\n */\\n@Data\\n@Builder\\n@NoArgsConstructor\\n@AllArgsConstructor\\n@JsonInclude(JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL)\\npublic class ValidationErrorDTO {\\n    \\n    /** Timestamp when the error occurred */\\n    @JsonFormat(pattern = \\"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss\\")\\n    private LocalDateTime timestamp;\\n    \\n    /** HTTP status code */\\n    private int status;\\n    \\n    /** Error type/name */\\n    private String error;\\n    \\n    /** Detailed error message */\\n    private String message;\\n    \\n    /** Request path that caused the error */\\n    private String path;\\n    \\n    /** List of field-specific validation errors */\\n    private List<FieldError> fieldErrors;\\n    \\n    /** Global validation errors (not tied to a specific field) */\\n    private List<String> globalErrors;\\n    \\n    /** Additional error details (context-specific) */\\n    private Map<String, Object> details;\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Inner class representing a field-specific validation error.\\n     */\\n    @Data\\n    @Builder\\n    @NoArgsConstructor\\n    @AllArgsConstructor\\n    public static class FieldError {\\n        /** Name of the field with the error */\\n        private String field;\\n        \\n        /** Rejected value (if available) */\\n        private Object rejectedValue;\\n        \\n        /** Error message */\\n        private String message;\\n        \\n        /** Error code/category */\\n        private String code;\\n        \\n        /**\\n         * Creates a formatted string representation of the field error.\\n         * \\n         * @return Formatted error string\\n         */\\n        public String getFormattedError() {\\n            String valueStr = rejectedValue != null ? rejectedValue.toString() : \\"null\\";\\n            return String.format(\\"Field \'%s\': %s (value: %s, code: %s)\\", \\n                    field, message, valueStr, code);\\n        }\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates a ValidationErrorDTO from field errors.\\n     * \\n     * @param fieldErrors List of field-specific errors\\n     * @param path The request path\\n     * @return ValidationErrorDTO instance\\n     */\\n    public static ValidationErrorDTO fromFieldErrors(List<FieldError> fieldErrors, String path) {\\n        return ValidationErrorDTO.builder()\\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .status(400)\\n                .error(\\"Validation Failed\\")\\n                .message(\\"One or more validation errors occurred\\")\\n                .path(path)\\n                .fieldErrors(fieldErrors)\\n                .globalErrors(new ArrayList<>())\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates a ValidationErrorDTO for a single field error.\\n     * \\n     * @param field The field with error\\n     * @param rejectedValue The rejected value\\n     * @param message Error message\\n     * @param path The request path\\n     * @return ValidationErrorDTO instance\\n     */\\n    public static ValidationErrorDTO createFieldError(String field, Object rejectedValue, \\n                                                      String message, String path) {\\n        FieldError fieldError = FieldError.builder()\\n                .field(field)\\n                .rejectedValue(rejectedValue)\\n                .message(message)\\n                .code(\\"VALIDATION_ERROR\\")\\n                .build();\\n        \\n        List<FieldError> fieldErrors = new ArrayList<>();\\n        fieldErrors.add(fieldError);\\n        \\n        return fromFieldErrors(fieldErrors, path);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates a ValidationErrorDTO for global errors.\\n     * \\n     * @param globalErrors List of global error messages\\n     * @param path The request path\\n     * @return ValidationErrorDTO instance\\n     */\\n    public static ValidationErrorDTO fromGlobalErrors(List<String> globalErrors, String path) {\\n        return ValidationErrorDTO.builder()\\n                .timestamp(LocalDateTime.now())\\n                .status(400)\\n                .error(\\"Validation Failed\\")\\n                .message(\\"One or more validation errors occurred\\")\\n                .path(path)\\n                .fieldErrors(new ArrayList<>())\\n                .globalErrors(globalErrors)\\n                .build();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Adds a field error to this DTO.\\n     * \\n     * @param fieldError The field error to add\\n     */\\n    public void addFieldError(FieldError fieldError) {\\n        if (fieldErrors == null) {\\n            fieldErrors = new ArrayList<>();\\n        }\\n        fieldErrors.add(fieldError);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Adds a simple field error.\\n     * \\n     * @param field Field name\\n     * @param rejectedValue Rejected value\\n     * @param message Error message\\n     */\\n    public void addFieldError(String field, Object rejectedValue, String message) {\\n        FieldError fieldError = FieldError.builder()\\n                .field(field)\\n                .rejectedValue(rejectedValue)\\n                .message(message)\\n                .code(\\"VALIDATION_ERROR\\")\\n                .build();\\n        addFieldError(fieldError);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Adds a global error message.\\n     * \\n     * @param errorMessage Global error message\\n     */\\n    public void addGlobalError(String errorMessage) {\\n        if (globalErrors == null) {\\n            globalErrors = new ArrayList<>();\\n        }\\n        globalErrors.add(errorMessage);\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if there are any validation errors.\\n     * \\n     * @return true if there are errors, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    public boolean hasErrors() {\\n        boolean hasFieldErrors = fieldErrors != null && !fieldErrors.isEmpty();\\n        boolean hasGlobalErrors = globalErrors != null && !globalErrors.isEmpty();\\n        return hasFieldErrors || hasGlobalErrors;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Gets the total number of validation errors.\\n     * \\n     * @return Total error count\\n     */\\n    public int getErrorCount() {\\n        int fieldErrorCount = fieldErrors != null ? fieldErrors.size() : 0;\\n        int globalErrorCount = globalErrors != null ? globalErrors.size() : 0;\\n        return fieldErrorCount + globalErrorCount;\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Creates a formatted summary of all validation errors.\\n     * \\n     * @return Summary string\\n     */\\n    public String getErrorSummary() {\\n        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder();\\n        summary.append(\\"Validation failed with \\").append(getErrorCount()).append(\\" error(s):\\\\n\\");\\n        \\n        if (fieldErrors != null && !fieldErrors.isEmpty()) {\\n            summary.append(\\"Field errors:\\\\n\\");\\n            for (int i = 0; i < fieldErrors.size(); i++) {\\n                FieldError error = fieldErrors.get(i);\\n                summary.append(String.format(\\"  %d. %s\\\\n\\", i + 1, error.getFormattedError()));\\n            }\\n        }\\n        \\n        if (globalErrors != null && !globalErrors.isEmpty()) {\\n            summary.append(\\"Global errors:\\\\n\\");\\n            for (int i = 0; i < globalErrors.size(); i++) {\\n                String error = globalErrors.get(i);\\n                summary.append(String.format(\\"  %d. %s\\\\n\\", i + 1, error));\\n            }\\n        }\\n        \\n        return summary.toString();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Converts this DTO to a TouristResponse for API consistency.\\n     * \\n     * @return TouristResponse with validation error details\\n     */\\n    public TouristResponse toTouristResponse() {\\n        return TouristResponse.validationError(this);\\n    }\\n}"\n        }\n    },\n    {\n        "command_name": "Plan.finish_current_task",\n        "args": {}\n  * Finds audit logs performed within a date range.\\n     * \\n     * @param startDate Start date (inclusive)\\n     * @param endDate End date (inclusive)\\n     * @return List of audit logs performed within the date range\\n     */\\n    List<AuditLog> findByPerformedAtBetween(LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime endDate);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Finds audit logs by IP address.\\n     * \\n     * @param ipAddress IP address\\n     * @return List of audit logs from the specified IP address\\n     */\\n    List<AuditLog> findByIpAddress(String ipAddress);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Complex query to find audit logs with multiple criteria.\\n     * All parameters are optional - null parameters are ignored in the query.\\n     * \\n     * @param action Action type\\n     * @param entityType Entity type\\n     * @param entityId Entity ID\\n     * @param performedBy Performed by\\n     * @param successful Success status\\n     * @param startDate Start date\\n     * @param endDate End date\\n     * @return List of matching audit logs\\n     */\\n    @Query(\\"SELECT a FROM AuditLog a WHERE \\" +\\n           \\"(:action IS NULL OR a.action = :action) AND \\" +\\n           \\"(:entityType IS NULL OR a.entityType = :entityType) AND \\" +\\n           \\"(:entityId IS NULL OR a.entityId = :entityId) AND \\" +\\n           \\"(:performedBy IS NULL OR a.performedBy = \\"(:endDate IS NULL OR a.performedAt <= :endDate) \\" +\\n           \\"ORDER BY a.performedAt DESC\\")\\n    List<AuditLog> searchAuditLogs(\\n            @Param(\\"action\\") String action,\\n audit logs by entity type.\\n     * \\n     * @param entityType Entity type\\n     * @return Number of audit logs for the specified entity type\\n     */\\n    long countByEntityType(String entityType);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Counts audit logs by success status.\\n     * \\n     * @param successful Success status\\n     * @return Number of audit logs with the specified success status\\n     */\\n    long countBySuccessful(Boolean successful);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Counts audit logs by performed by user.\\n     * \\n     * @param performedBy Performed by user\\n     * @return Number of audit logs performed by the specified user\\n     */\\n    long countByPerformedBy(String performedBy);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Finds the most recent audit logs for a specific entity.\\n     * \\n     * @param entityType Entity type\\n     * @param entityId Entity ID\\n     * @param limit Maximum number of logs to return\\n     * @return List of recent audit logs for the entity\\n     */\\n    @Query(\\"SELECT a FROM AuditLog a WHERE a.entityType = :entityType AND a.entityId = :entityId \\" +\\n           \\"ORDER BY a.performedAt DESC LIMIT :limit\\")\\n    List<AuditLog> findRecentByEntity(\\n            @Param(\\"entityType\\") String entityType,\\n            @Param(\\"entityId\\") Long entityId,\\n            @Param(\\"limit\\") int limit);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Finds failed audit logs (unsuccessful operations).\\n     * \\n     * @param limit Maximum number of logs to return\\n     * @return List of recent failed audit logs\\n     */\\n    @Query(\\"SELECT a FROM AuditLog a WHERE a.successful = false \\" +\\n           \\"ORDER BY a.performedAt DESC LIMIT :limit\\")\\n    List<AuditLog> findRecentFailures(@Param(\\"limit\\") int limit);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Finds audit logs for tourist modifications.\\n     * Specifically looks for UPDATE_TOURIST actions.\\n     * \\n     * @param touristId Tourist ID\\n     * @param limit Maximum number of logs to return\\n     * @return List of modification audit logs for the tourist\\n     */\\n    default List<AuditLog> findTouristModifications(Long touristId, int limit) {\\n        return findRecentByEntity(\\"Tourist\\", touristId, limit)\\n                .stream()\\n                .filter(log -> \\"UPDATE_TOURIST\\".equals(log.getAction()))\\n                .toList();\\n    }\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Checks if an entity has been modified within a time period.\\n     * \\n     * @param entityType Entity type\\n     * @param entityId Entity ID\\n     * @param sinceDate Check modifications since this date\\n     * @return true if the entity has been modified since the date, false otherwise\\n     */\\n    @Query(\\"SELECT COUNT(a) > 0 FROM AuditLog a WHERE \\" +\\n           \\"a.entityType = :entityType AND a.entityId = :entityId AND \\" +\\n           \\"a.action LIKE \'%UPDATE%\' AND a.performedAt >= :sinceDate\\")\\n    boolean hasBeenModifiedSince(\\n            @Param(\\"entityType\\") String entityType,\\n            @Param(\\"entityId\\") Long entityId,\\n            @Param(\\"sinceDate\\") LocalDateTime sinceDate);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Deletes old audit logs before a specific date.\\n     * Used for audit log rotation and cleanup.\\n     * \\n     * @param cutoffDate Delete logs before this date\\n     * @return Number of logs deleted\\n     */\\n    @Query(\\"DELETE FROM AuditLog a WHERE a.performedAt < :cutoffDate\\")\\n    int deleteOldLogs(@Param(\\"cutoffDate\\") LocalDateTime cutoffDate);\\n    \\n    /**\\n     * Gets audit log statistics by date range.\\n     * Returns counts grouped by action type.\\n     * \\n     * @param startDate Start date\\n     * @param endDate End date\\n     * @return List of Object arrays where [0] = action, [1] = count\\n     */\\n    @Query(\\"SELECT a.action, COUNT(a) FROM AuditLog a WHERE \\" +\\n           \\"a.performedAt BETWEEN :startDate AND :endDate \\" ```json
[
    {
        "command_name": "Editor.write",
        "args": {
            "path": "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/service/impl/TouristServiceImpl.java",
            "content": "package com.etour.service.impl;\n\nimport com.etour.client.ETOURServerClient;\nimport com.etour.dto.TouristDTO;\nimport com.etour.dto.TouristResponse;\nimport com.etour.dto.TouristUpdateRequest;\nimport com.etour.dto.ValidationErrorDTO;\nimport com.etour.entity.Tourist;\nimport com.etour.exception.ETourConnectionException;\nimport com.etour.exception.TouristNotFoundException;\nimport com.etour.exception.ValidationException;\nimport com.etour.repository.TouristRepository;\nimport com.etour.service.AuditService;\nimport com.etour.service.TouristService;\nimport com.etour.service.ValidationService;\nimport com.etour.util.RetryUtil;\nimport jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;\nimport lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;\nimport lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;\nimport org.springframework.stereotype.Service;\nimport org.springframework.transaction.annotation.Transactional;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\nimport java.util.HashMap;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Map;\nimport java.util.UUID;\nimport java.util.stream.Collectors;\n\n/**\n * Implementation of the TouristService interface.\n * Contains business logic for tourist account management, including\n * the complete ModifyTouristAccountData use case workflow.\n */\n@Service\n@RequiredArgsConstructor\n@Slf4j\npublic class TouristServiceImpl implements TouristService {\n    \n    private final TouristRepository touristRepository;\n    private final ValidationService validationService;\n    private final AuditService auditService;\n    private final ETOURServerClient etourServerClient;\n    private final RetryUtil retryUtil;\n    \n    private static final String UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION = \"UPDATE_TOURIST\";\n    private static final String CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION = \"CREATE_TOURIST\";\n    private static final String CHANGE_STATUS_ACTION = \"CHANGE_TOURIST_STATUS\";\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristDTO getTouristById(Long id) {\n        log.debug(\"Retrieving tourist with ID: {}\", id);\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        return TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristDTO getTouristByEmail(String email) {\n        log.debug(\"Retrieving tourist with email: {}\", email);\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findByEmail(email)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with email: \" + email));\n        return TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<TouristDTO> searchTourists(String firstName, String lastName, String email, \n                                          String nationality, Boolean active) {\n        log.debug(\"Searching tourists with criteria: firstName={}, lastName={}, email={}, nationality={}, active={}\",\n                firstName, lastName, email, nationality, active);\n        \n        List<Tourist> tourists = touristRepository.searchTourists(firstName, lastName, email, nationality, active);\n        return tourists.stream()\n                .map(TouristDTO::fromEntity)\n                .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse updateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest, \n                                        String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Updating tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Step 1: Retrieve the tourist\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Step 2: Validate the update request\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.warn(\"Validation failed for tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Check if there are actual changes\n        if (!updateRequest.hasChanges(original)) {\n            log.info(\"No changes detected for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No changes required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Prepare confirmation response\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        log.info(\"Update confirmation required for tourist ID: {} with changes: {}\", id, updateRequest.getUpdateSummary());\n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Please confirm the changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public ValidationErrorDTO validateTouristUpdate(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        log.debug(\"Validating update request for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n        \n        ValidationErrorDTO errors = new ValidationErrorDTO();\n        \n        // Check if update request is empty\n        if (updateRequest.isEmpty()) {\n            errors.addGlobalError(\"Update request is empty\");\n            return errors;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null && !isEmailAvailable(updateRequest.getEmail(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"email\", updateRequest.getEmail(), \n                    \"Email is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate passport number uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getPassportNumber() != null && \n            !isPassportNumberAvailable(updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"passportNumber\", updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), \n                    \"Passport number is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate individual fields using validation service\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO emailErrors = validationService.validateEmail(updateRequest.getEmail());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(emailErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getPhoneNumber() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO phoneErrors = validationService.validatePhoneNumber(updateRequest.getPhoneNumber());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(phoneErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getDateOfBirth() != null && updateRequest.getDateOfBirth().isAfter(java.time.LocalDate.now())) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"dateOfBirth\", updateRequest.getDateOfBirth(), \n                    \"Date of birth cannot be in the future\");\n        }\n        \n        return errors;\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse prepareUpdateConfirmation(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        // This is essentially the same logic as the confirmation step in updateTourist\n        // but separated for clarity in the use case flow\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        \n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Confirm tourist account changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse confirmAndUpdateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest,\n                                                  String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request,\n                                                  String confirmationToken) {\n        log.info(\"Confirming and applying update for tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Verify confirmation token (idempotency check)\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        String expectedToken = generateConfirmationToken(id, changes);\n        \n        if (confirmationToken != null && !confirmationToken.equals(expectedToken)) {\n            log.warn(\"Invalid confirmation token for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Invalid confirmation token\", 400, null);\n        }\n        \n        // Re-validate (in case request was modified)\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.error(\"Validation failed during confirmation for tourist ID {}: {}\", \n                    id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 5: Apply the changes\n            tourist.updateFrom(updateRequest);\n            tourist.validate(); // Ensure entity is still valid after update\n            \n            // Step 6: Store modified data\n            Tourist savedTourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(savedTourist);\n            \n            // Step 6a: Sync with ETOUR server (with retry logic)\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\n            \n            // Audit successful update\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully updated tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.updateSuccess(updated);\n            \n        } catch (ValidationException e) {\n            log.error(\"Validation exception during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Validation failed: \" + e.getMessage(), 400, null);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist update was successful locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            // We should still return success but log the ETOUR failure\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            auditService.logActionWithWarning(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, \"ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            return TouristResponse.success(\n                    \"Tourist updated locally, but ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), \n                    updated);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage(), e);\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.serverError(\"Internal server error during update\");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse setTouristActiveStatus(Long id, TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        if (tourist.getActive() == active) {\n            log.info(\"Tourist ID {} already has active status: {}\", id, active);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No change required\", original);\n        }\n        \n TouristResponse.success(message, updated);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<Map<String, Object>> getTouristChangeHistory(Long id, int limit) {\n        log.debug(\"Getting change history validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Tourist tourist = touristDTO.toEntity();\n            tourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO created = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            \n            // Sync with ETOUR server\n tourist.getId(), \n                    operatorUsername, null, created, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully created tourist ID: {}\", tourist.getId());\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"Tourist account created successfully\", created);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist creation: {}\", e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist was created locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Tourist created locally, but ETOUR sync failed\", 207, null);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist creation: {}\", e.getMessage(), e);\n com.etour.service.TouristService;\nimport com.etour.service.ValidationService;\nimport com.etour.util.RetryUtil;\nimport jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;\nimport lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;\nimport lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;\nimport org.springframework.stereotype.Service;\nimport org.springframework.transaction.annotation.Transactional;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\nimport java.util.HashMap;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Map;\nimport java.util.UUID;\nimport java.util.stream.Collectors;\n\n/**\n * Implementation of the TouristService interface.\n * Contains business logic for tourist account management, including\n * the complete ModifyTouristAccountData use case workflow.\n */\n@Service\n@RequiredArgsConstructor\n@Slf4j\npublic class TouristServiceImpl implements TouristService {\n    \n    private final TouristRepository touristRepository;\n    private final ValidationService validationService;\n    private final AuditService auditService;\n    private final ETOURServerClient etourServerClient;\n    private final RetryUtil retryUtil;\n    \n    private  @Override\n    public TouristDTO getTouristByEmail(String email) {\n        log.debug(\"Retrieving tourist with email: {}\", email);\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findByEmail(email)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with email: \" + email));\n        return TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<TouristDTO> searchTourists(String firstName, String lastName, String email, \n                                          String nationality, Boolean active) {\n        log.debug(\"Searching tourists with criteria: firstName={}, lastName={}, email={}, nationality={}, active={}\",\n                firstName, lastName, email, nationality, active);\n        \n        List<Tourist> tourists = touristRepository.searchTourists(firstName, lastName, email, nationality, active);\n        return tourists.stream()\n                .map(TouristDTO::fromEntity)\n                .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse updateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest, \n                                        String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Updating tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Step 1: Retrieve the tourist\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Step 2: Validate the update request\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.warn(\"Validation failed for tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Check if there are actual changes\n        if (!updateRequest.hasChanges(original)) {\n            log.info(\"No changes detected for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No changes required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Prepare confirmation response\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        log.info(\"Update confirmation required for tourist ID: {} with changes: {}\", id, updateRequest.getUpdateSummary());\n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Please confirm the changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public ValidationErrorDTO validateTouristUpdate(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        log.debug(\"Validating update request for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n        \n        ValidationErrorDTO errors = new ValidationErrorDTO();\n        \n        // Check if update request is empty\n        if (updateRequest.isEmpty()) {\n            errors.addGlobalError(\"Update request is empty\");\n            return errors;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null && !isEmailAvailable(updateRequest.getEmail(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"email\", updateRequest.getEmail(), \n                    \"Email is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate passport number uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getPassportNumber() != null && \n            !isPassportNumberAvailable(updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"passportNumber\", updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), \n                    \"Passport number is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate individual fields using validation service\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO emailErrors = validationService.validateEmail(updateRequest.getEmail());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(emailErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getPhoneNumber() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO phoneErrors = validationService.validatePhoneNumber(updateRequest.getPhoneNumber());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(phoneErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getDateOfBirth() != null && updateRequest.getDateOfBirth().isAfter(java.time.LocalDate.now())) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"dateOfBirth\", updateRequest.getDateOfBirth(), \n                    \"Date of birth cannot be in the future\");\n        }\n        \n        return errors;\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse prepareUpdateConfirmation(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        // This is essentially the same logic as the confirmation step in updateTourist\n        // but separated for clarity in the use case flow\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        \n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Confirm tourist account changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse confirmAndUpdateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest,\n                                                  String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request,\n                                                  String confirmationToken) {\n        log.info(\"Confirming and applying update for tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Verify confirmation token (idempotency check)\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        String expectedToken = generateConfirmationToken(id, changes);\n        \n        if (confirmationToken != null && !confirmationToken.equals(expectedToken)) {\n            log.warn(\"Invalid confirmation token for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Invalid confirmation token\", 400, null);\n        }\n        \n        // Re-validate (in case request was modified)\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.error(\"Validation failed during confirmation for tourist ID {}: {}\", \n                    id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 5: Apply the changes\n            tourist.updateFrom(updateRequest);\n            tourist.validate(); // Ensure entity is still valid after update\n            \n            // Step 6: Store modified data\n            Tourist savedTourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(savedTourist);\n            \n            // Step 6a: Sync with ETOUR server (with retry logic)\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\n            \n            // Audit successful update\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully updated tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.updateSuccess(updated);\n            \n        } catch (ValidationException e) {\n            log.error(\"Validation exception during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Validation failed: \" + e.getMessage(), 400, null);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist update was successful locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            // We should still return success but log the ETOUR failure\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            auditService.logActionWithWarning(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, \"ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            return TouristResponse.success(\n                    \"Tourist updated locally, but ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), \n                    updated);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage(), e);\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.serverError(\"Internal server error during update\");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse setTouristActiveStatus(Long id, Boolean active, \n                                                 String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Setting active status for tourist ID: {} to {} by operator: {}\", \n                id, active, operatorUsername);\n        \n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        if (tourist.getActive() == active) {\n            log.info(\"Tourist ID {} already has active status: {}\", id, active);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No change required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        tourist.setActive(active);\n        tourist.setUpdatedAt(LocalDateTime.now());\n        tourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n        \n        TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Audit the status change\n        Map<String, Object> oldValues = new HashMap<>();\n        oldValues.put(\"active\", original.getActive());\n operatorUsername, request);\n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.warn(\"ETOUR sync failed for status change of tourist ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n        }\n number is already in use by another tourist\\");\\n        }\\n        \\n        // Validate individual fields using validation service\\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null) {\\n                     String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request,\\n                                                  String confirmationToken) {\\n        log.info(\\"Confirming and applying                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\\"Tourist not found with ID: \\" + id));\\n        \\n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\\n         TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(savedTourist);\\n            \\n            // Step 6a: Sync with ETOUR server (with retry logic)\\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\\n            \\n            // Audit successful update\\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \\"Tourist\\", id, operatorUsername, \\n                    original, updated, getClientInfo(request));\\n            \\n            log.info(\\"Successfully updated tourist ID: {}\\", id);\\n            return TouristResponse.updateSuccess(updated);\\n            \\n        } catch (ValidationException e) {\\n            log.error(\\"Validation exception during tourist update ID {}: {}\\", id, e.getMessage());\\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \\"Tourist\\", id, operatorUsername, \\n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\\n            original, updated, \\"ETOUR sync failed: \\" + e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\\n            \\n            return TouristResponse.success(\\n                    \\"Tourist updated update ID {}: {}\\", id, e.getMessage(), e);\\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \\"Tourist\\", id, operatorUsername, \\n                    e.getMessage(),  @Override\n    public TouristDTO getTouristByEmail(String email) {\n        log.debug(\"Retrieving tourist with email: {}\", email);\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findByEmail(email)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with email: \" + email));\n        return TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<TouristDTO> searchTourists(String firstName, String lastName, String email, \n                                          String nationality, Boolean active) {\n        log.debug(\"Searching .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse updateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest, \n                                        String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Updating tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Step 1: Retrieve the tourist\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Step 2: Validate the update request\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.warn(\"Validation failed for tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Check if there are actual changes\n        if (!updateRequest.hasChanges(original)) {\n            log.info(\"No changes detected for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No changes required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Prepare confirmation response\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        log.info(\"Update confirmation required for tourist ID: {} with changes: {}\", id, updateRequest.getUpdateSummary());\n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Please confirm the changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public ValidationErrorDTO validateTouristUpdate(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        log.debug(\"Validating update request for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n        \n        ValidationErrorDTO errors = new ValidationErrorDTO();\n        \n        // Check if update request is empty\n        if (updateRequest.isEmpty()) {\n            errors.addGlobalError(\"Update request is empty\");\n            return errors;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null && !isEmailAvailable(updateRequest.getEmail(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"email\", updateRequest.getEmail(), \n                    \"Email is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate passport number uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getPassportNumber() != null && \n            !isPassportNumberAvailable(updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"passportNumber\", updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), \n                    \"Passport number is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate individual fields using validation service\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO emailErrors = validationService.validateEmail(updateRequest.getEmail());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(emailErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getPhoneNumber() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO phoneErrors = validationService.validatePhoneNumber(updateRequest.getPhoneNumber());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(phoneErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getDateOfBirth() != null && updateRequest.getDateOfBirth().isAfter(java.time.LocalDate.now())) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"dateOfBirth\", updateRequest.getDateOfBirth(), \n                    \"Date of birth cannot be in the future\");\n        }\n        \n        return errors;\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse prepareUpdateConfirmation(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        // This is essentially the same logic as the confirmation step in updateTourist\n        // but separated for clarity in the use case flow\n TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        \n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Confirm tourist account changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse confirmAndUpdateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest,\n                                                  String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request,\n                                                  String confirmationToken) {\n        log.info(\"Confirming and applying update for tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Verify confirmation token (idempotency check)\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        String expectedToken = generateConfirmationToken(id, changes);\n        \n        if (confirmationToken != null && !confirmationToken.equals(expectedToken)) {\n            log.warn(\"Invalid confirmation token for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Invalid confirmation token\", 400, null);\n        }\n        \n        // Re-validate (in case request was modified)\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.error(\"Validation failed during confirmation for tourist ID {}: {}\", \n                    id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 5: Apply the changes\n            tourist.updateFrom(updateRequest);\n            tourist.validate(); // Ensure entity is still valid after update\n            \n            // Step 6: Store modified data\n            Tourist savedTourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(savedTourist);\n            \n            // Step 6a: Sync with ETOUR server (with retry logic)\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\n            \n            // Audit successful update\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully updated tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.updateSuccess(updated);\n            \n        } catch (ValidationException e) {\n            log.error(\"Validation exception during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Validation failed: \" + e.getMessage(), 400, null);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist update was successful locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            // We should still return success but log the ETOUR failure\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            auditService.logActionWithWarning(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, \"ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            return TouristResponse.success(\n                    \"Tourist updated locally, but ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), \n                    updated);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage(), e);\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.serverError(\"Internal server error during update\");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse setTouristActiveStatus(Long id, Boolean active, \n                                                 String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Setting active status for tourist ID: {} to {} by operator: {}\", \n                id, active, operatorUsername);\n        \n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() => new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        if (tourist.getActive() == active) {\n            log.info(\"Tourist ID {} already has active status: {}\", id, active);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No change required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        tourist.setActive(active);\n        tourist.setUpdatedAt(LocalDateTime.now());\n        tourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n        \n        TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Audit the status change\n        Map<String, Object> oldValues = new HashMap<>();\n        oldValues.put(\"active\", original.getActive());\n        \n        Map<String, Object> newValues = new HashMap<>();\n        newValues.put(\"active\", active);\n        \n        auditService.logAction(CHANGE_STATUS_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                oldValues, newValues, getClientInfo(request));\n        \n        // Sync with ETOUR server\n        try {\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.warn(\"ETOUR sync failed for status change of tourist ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        String message = active ? \"Tourist account activated successfully\" \n                               : \"Tourist account deactivated successfully\";\n        return TouristResponse.success(message, updated);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<Map<String, Object>> getTouristChangeHistory(Long id, int limit) {\n        log.debug(\"Getting change history for tourist ID: {} (limit: {})\", id, limit);\n        \n        if (!touristExists(id)) {\n            throw new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id);\n        }\n        \n        return auditService.getEntityChangeHistory(\"Tourist\", id, limit);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse createTourist(TouristDTO touristDTO, String operatorUsername, \n                                        HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Creating new tourist by operator: {}\", operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Validate tourist data\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validationService.validateTourist(touristDTO);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.warn(\"Validation failed for tourist creation: {}\", validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", null, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Tourist tourist = touristDTO.toEntity();\n            tourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO created = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            \n            // Sync with ETOUR server\n            syncWithETOURServer(created, operatorUsername, request);\n            \n            // Audit creation\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", tourist.getId(), \n                    operatorUsername, null, created, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully created tourist ID: {}\", tourist.getId());\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"Tourist account created successfully\", created);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist creation: {}\", e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist was created locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Tourist created locally, but ETOUR sync failed\", 207, null);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist creation: {}\", e.getMessage(), e);\n            auditService.logFailedAction(CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", null, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Failed to create tourist account\", 500, null);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    // Private helper methods\n    \n    private boolean isEmailAvailable(String email, Long excludeTouristId) {\n        return touristRepository.findByEmail(email)\n                .map(t -> t.getId().equals(excludeTouristId))\n                .orElse(true);\n    }\n    \n

Let me first write the TouristServiceImpl class with comprehensive implementation of the update logic, validation, confirmation workflow, and audit logging.

```json
[
    {
        "command_name": "Editor.write",
        "args": {
            "path": "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/tourist-account-system/src/main/java/com/etour/service/impl/TouristServiceImpl.java",
            "content": "package com.etour.service.impl;\n\nimport com.etour.client.ETOURServerClient;\nimport com.etour.dto.TouristDTO;\nimport com.etour.dto.TouristResponse;\nimport com.etour.dto.TouristUpdateRequest;\nimport com.etour.dto.ValidationErrorDTO;\nimport com.etour.entity.Tourist;\nimport com.etour.exception.ETourConnectionException;\nimport com.etour.exception.TouristNotFoundException;\nimport com.etour.exception.ValidationException;\nimport com.etour.repository.TouristRepository;\nimport com.etour.service.AuditService;\nimport com.etour.service.TouristService;\nimport com.etour.service.ValidationService;\nimport com.etour.util.RetryUtil;\nimport jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;\nimport lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;\nimport lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;\nimport org.springframework.stereotype.Service;\nimport org.springframework.transaction.annotation.Transactional;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDateTime;\nimport java.util.HashMap;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Map;\nimport java.util.UUID;\nimport java.util.stream.Collectors;\n\n/**\n * Implementation of the TouristService interface.\n * Contains business logic for tourist account management, including\n * the complete ModifyTouristAccountData use case workflow.\n */\n@Service\n@RequiredArgsConstructor\n@Slf4j\npublic class TouristServiceImpl implements TouristService {\n    \n    private final TouristRepository touristRepository;\n    private final ValidationService validationService;\n    private final AuditService auditService;\n    private final ETOURServerClient etourServerClient;\n    private final RetryUtil retryUtil;\n    \n    private static final String UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION = \"UPDATE_TOURIST\";\n    private static final String CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION = \"CREATE_TOURIST\";\n    private static final String CHANGE_STATUS_ACTION = \"CHANGE_TOURIST_STATUS\";\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristDTO getTouristById(Long id) {\n        log.debug(\"Retrieving tourist with ID: {}\", id);\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        return TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristDTO getTouristByEmail(String email) {\n        log.debug(\"Retrieving tourist with email: {}\", email);\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findByEmail(email)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with email: \" + email));\n        return TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<TouristDTO> searchTourists(String firstName, String lastName, String email, \n                                          String nationality, Boolean active) {\n        log.debug(\"Searching tourists with criteria: firstName={}, lastName={}, email={}, nationality={}, active={}\",\n                firstName, lastName, email, nationality, active);\n        \n        List<Tourist> tourists = touristRepository.searchTourists(firstName, lastName, email, nationality, active);\n        return tourists.stream()\n                .map(TouristDTO::fromEntity)\n                .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse updateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest, \n                                        String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Updating tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Step 1: Retrieve the tourist\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Step 2: Validate the update request\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.warn(\"Validation failed for tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Check if there are actual changes\n        if (!updateRequest.hasChanges(original)) {\n            log.info(\"No changes detected for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No changes required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Prepare confirmation response\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        log.info(\"Update confirmation required for tourist ID: {} with changes: {}\", id, updateRequest.getUpdateSummary());\n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Please confirm the changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public ValidationErrorDTO validateTouristUpdate(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        log.debug(\"Validating update request for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n        \n        ValidationErrorDTO errors = new ValidationErrorDTO();\n        \n        // Check if update request is empty\n        if (updateRequest.isEmpty()) {\n            errors.addGlobalError(\"Update request is empty\");\n            return errors;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null && !isEmailAvailable(updateRequest.getEmail(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"email\", updateRequest.getEmail(), \n                    \"Email is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate passport number uniqueness if being changed\n        if (updateRequest.getPassportNumber() != null && \n            !isPassportNumberAvailable(updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), id)) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"passportNumber\", updateRequest.getPassportNumber(), \n                    \"Passport number is already in use by another tourist\");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate individual fields using validation service\n        if (updateRequest.getEmail() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO emailErrors = validationService.validateEmail(updateRequest.getEmail());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(emailErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getPhoneNumber() != null) {\n            ValidationErrorDTO phoneErrors = validationService.validatePhoneNumber(updateRequest.getPhoneNumber());\n            errors.getFieldErrors().addAll(phoneErrors.getFieldErrors());\n        }\n        \n        if (updateRequest.getDateOfBirth() != null && updateRequest.getDateOfBirth().isAfter(java.time.LocalDate.now())) {\n            errors.addFieldError(\"dateOfBirth\", updateRequest.getDateOfBirth(), \n                    \"Date of birth cannot be in the future\");\n        }\n        \n        return errors;\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public TouristResponse prepareUpdateConfirmation(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest) {\n        // This is essentially the same logic as the confirmation step in updateTourist\n        // but separated for clarity in the use case flow\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        \n        Map<String, Object> confirmationData = new HashMap<>();\n        confirmationData.put(\"touristId\", id);\n        confirmationData.put(\"original\", original);\n        confirmationData.put(\"changes\", changes);\n        confirmationData.put(\"confirmationToken\", generateConfirmationToken(id, changes));\n        \n        return TouristResponse.confirmationRequired(\"Confirm tourist account changes\", confirmationData);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse confirmAndUpdateTourist(Long id, TouristUpdateRequest updateRequest,\n                                                  String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request,\n                                                  String confirmationToken) {\n        log.info(\"Confirming and applying update for tourist ID: {} by operator: {}\", id, operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Verify confirmation token (idempotency check)\n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        Map<String, Object> changes = updateRequest.getChangedValuesMap(original);\n        String expectedToken = generateConfirmationToken(id, changes);\n        \n        if (confirmationToken != null && !confirmationToken.equals(expectedToken)) {\n            log.warn(\"Invalid confirmation token for tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Invalid confirmation token\", 400, null);\n        }\n        \n        // Re-validate (in case request was modified)\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validateTouristUpdate(id, updateRequest);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.error(\"Validation failed during confirmation for tourist ID {}: {}\", \n                    id, validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 5: Apply the changes\n            tourist.updateFrom(updateRequest);\n            tourist.validate(); // Ensure entity is still valid after update\n            \n            // Step 6: Store modified data\n            Tourist savedTourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(savedTourist);\n            \n            // Step 6a: Sync with ETOUR server (with retry logic)\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\n            \n            // Audit successful update\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully updated tourist ID: {}\", id);\n            return TouristResponse.updateSuccess(updated);\n            \n        } catch (ValidationException e) {\n            log.error(\"Validation exception during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Validation failed: \" + e.getMessage(), 400, null);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist update was successful locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            // We should still return success but log the ETOUR failure\n            TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            auditService.logActionWithWarning(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    original, updated, \"ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            return TouristResponse.success(\n                    \"Tourist updated locally, but ETOUR sync failed: \" + e.getMessage(), \n                    updated);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist update ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage(), e);\n            auditService.logFailedAction(UPDATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.serverError(\"Internal server error during update\");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse setTouristActiveStatus(Long id, Boolean active, \n                                                 String operatorUsername, HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Setting active status for tourist ID: {} to {} by operator: {}\", \n                id, active, operatorUsername);\n        \n        Tourist tourist = touristRepository.findById(id)\n                .orElseThrow(() -> new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id));\n        \n        TouristDTO original = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        if (tourist.getActive() == active) {\n            log.info(\"Tourist ID {} already has active status: {}\", id, active);\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"No change required\", original);\n        }\n        \n        tourist.setActive(active);\n        tourist.setUpdatedAt(LocalDateTime.now());\n        tourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n        \n        TouristDTO updated = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n        \n        // Audit the status change\n        Map<String, Object> oldValues = new HashMap<>();\n        oldValues.put(\"active\", original.getActive());\n        \n        Map<String, Object> newValues = new HashMap<>();\n        newValues.put(\"active\", active);\n        \n        auditService.logAction(CHANGE_STATUS_ACTION, \"Tourist\", id, operatorUsername, \n                oldValues, newValues, getClientInfo(request));\n        \n        // Sync with ETOUR server\n        try {\n            syncWithETOURServer(updated, operatorUsername, request);\n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.warn(\"ETOUR sync failed for status change of tourist ID {}: {}\", id, e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        String message = active ? \"Tourist account activated successfully\" \n                               : \"Tourist account deactivated successfully\";\n        return TouristResponse.success(message, updated);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    public List<Map<String, Object>> getTouristChangeHistory(Long id, int limit) {\n        log.debug(\"Getting change history for tourist ID: {} (limit: {})\", id, limit);\n        \n        if (!touristExists(id)) {\n            throw new TouristNotFoundException(\"Tourist not found with ID: \" + id);\n        }\n        \n        return auditService.getEntityChangeHistory(\"Tourist\", id, limit);\n    }\n    \n    @Override\n    @Transactional\n    public TouristResponse createTourist(TouristDTO touristDTO, String operatorUsername, \n                                        HttpServletRequest request) {\n        log.info(\"Creating new tourist by operator: {}\", operatorUsername);\n        \n        // Validate tourist data\n        ValidationErrorDTO validationErrors = validationService.validateTourist(touristDTO);\n        if (validationErrors.hasErrors()) {\n            log.warn(\"Validation failed for tourist creation: {}\", validationErrors.getErrorSummary());\n            auditService.logFailedAction(CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", null, operatorUsername, \n                    validationErrors.getErrorSummary(), getClientInfo(request));\n            return TouristResponse.validationError(validationErrors);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            Tourist tourist = touristDTO.toEntity();\n            tourist = touristRepository.save(tourist);\n            TouristDTO created = TouristDTO.fromEntity(tourist);\n            \n            // Sync with ETOUR server\n            syncWithETOURServer(created, operatorUsername, request);\n            \n            // Audit creation\n            auditService.logSuccessfulAction(CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", tourist.getId(), \n                    operatorUsername, null, created, getClientInfo(request));\n            \n            log.info(\"Successfully created tourist ID: {}\", tourist.getId());\n            return TouristResponse.success(\"Tourist account created successfully\", created);\n            \n        } catch (ETourConnectionException e) {\n            log.error(\"ETOUR connection failed during tourist creation: {}\", e.getMessage());\n            // Note: Tourist was created locally, but ETOUR sync failed\n            return TouristResponse.error(\"Tourist created locally, but ETOUR sync failed\", 207, null);\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Unexpected error during tourist creation: {}\", e.getMessage(), e);\n            auditService.logFailedAction(CREATE_TOURIST_ACTION, \"Tourist\", null, operatorUsername, \n                    e.getMessage(), getClientInfo(request));\n
